result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis Deslandes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travis Deslandes

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Travis Deslandes in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's noncompliance with some of the conditions of probation, he was admonished.  Agent to contact the court to set a new review if necessary.

Defendant Travis Deslandes in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Additional Statement by:  Kwanesha B.
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 80 days in the House of Correction with credit for 4 days served  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for up to 12 months, concurrent,  with the following conditions:
- Serve 20 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges; civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Victim present in court requesting modification of the No Contact orders to a No Violent Contact order. Court reviewed participation form  State does not object. Court orders the No Violent Contact order.

AS TO COUNT 1 AS AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. Case adjourned to branch 36 for Sentencing. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.

Defendant Travis Deslandes in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Jury Trial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. 
AS TO COUNT 1
On motion of the State pursuant to plea negotiations, the Court ordered charge amended to REMOVE the Repeater enhancer, 939.62(1)(a).  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Travis Deslandes in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Jury Trial. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Jury Trial to branch 23.  Jury trial scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Prior: 4075 North 42nd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with K.D.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Travis Deslandes in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Travis Deslandes in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
